title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: "Jaane tu ya Jaane na"was ahead of its time and one of the better attempts at incorporating magical realism.

Recently watched 'Don't Breathe'...

My my... What crazy ride!

Thinking of watching these two movies : The fountain and Another Round.

Also thinking of watching The Wheel of Time.

who doesn't want to watch Mads Mikkelsen going crazy after 3-4 rounds.

edit : crazy
The Last Duel.. what a movie !

I’ve been watching The Expanse on Amazon Prime lately. It’s a great visual feat for SciFi lovers. The show is set in the future where humans have colonized other planets in the solar system. The lady who’s running things on Earth is shown to be an Indian. She wears elaborate Sarees and Indian accessories all the time, kind of like Rekha’s. She’s got a pretty important character in the show. It kind of felt good even if that casting choice was made in the name of diversity.
A pretty good movie with an excellent soundtrack by an A.R. Rahman who was at the creative peak of his career. But certainly not "ahead of its time".
Where did it have magical realism?
People having conversations with Naseerudin shah's portrait as if it was nothing out of the ordinary.
